This weekly bulletin informs students, parents, and staff about internships, academic
programs, jobs, community service options, and leadership initiatives, along with
other student opportunities in a variety of fields. Please carefully note deadlines, age
requirements, and other pre-requisites for participation.
For ease of use, these newsletters are organized by different categories, such as
Academic Programs, Business Internships & Jobs, STEM Opportunities, Community
Service, and so on.
Questions, suggestions, and information about other opportunities are always
welcome and appreciated, and may be sent to Internship/Opportunity Coordinator
Harvey Blumm at: hblumm@stuy.edu - we will share your helpful information with
the Stuy community!
There are many excellent opportunities in this issue - including several highlighted
below. Remember that it is fine to apply to and be accepted by several different
programs – students can then just pick the one(s) that are the best fit and decline the
others (in a timely way).
And please note that many programs have approaching application deadlines!
EVENTS: All students may attend the in-person Community Board 14 Youth
Programs Summer Fair on March 6th – the focus is on programs for that borough,
but some citywide options will be represented as well. And the Latin College Expo
event at NYU on March 14th is open to all (juniors are especially encouraged to
attend); various college representatives and college-support programs will be there.
BUSINESS/JOBS: The non-profit NYC Exploring program welcomes all students to
participate in their wide variety of free after-school sessions visiting the offices of
major companies, including the fields of engineering, medicine, law, business, and
more. Students get to meet professionals who can discuss career pathways, college
majors, internships, and other related topics. Some are scheduled for next week –
check them out! And the application deadline for the NYC Summer Youth
Employment Program (SYEP) has been extended to March 15th.
LEADERSHIP/LAW/GOVERNMENT: The Summer Justice Institute is a free one-
week program at the federal courthouse that provides an up-close look at various
components of the legal system to current 9th, 10th, and 11th graders.
Democracy Scholars is a free summer residential program at NYU which engages
rising seniors in a three-week experience of working with other students & professors
on social issues, along with guidance on college admissions. This support continues
on an occasional basis in senior year – participants work together throughout the
program. It’s open to all applicants; first-generation students are encouraged to apply.
STEM: All students may apply for the free in-person introductory Spring Break
Game Design Lab, offered from April 23-25. The Simons-NYU Summer Science
Exploration three-week program is open to all current 10th, 11th, and 12th grade
students (those from under-represented groups are encouraged to apply). Participants
delve into physical and biological science topics, with support from NYU faculty.
The Maimonides Hospital Women in Science summer program for current students
who identify as female is an excellent opportunity to meet and learn from medical
researchers, surgeons, and other clinicians. Current sophomores and older students (16
and up) from Manhattan, Staten Island, and the Bronx may apply to one of the two
free Student Health Internship Programs (SHIP) – participants spend six weeks
interacting with medical professionals.
And the Perry Initiative (for female-identifying students in the 10th grade or above)
offers another in-person event on Saturday, May 4th at the NYU Langone Medical
Center in Manhattan. Interested students should apply ASAP.
SCHOLARSHIPS: Our ever-supportive Alumni Association welcomes applications
for their wide variety of 40+ scholarships for graduating seniors (and one for a
current junior). These awards are open only to Stuy students – be sure to check the
link to learn more!
